summary: All I Have 13/15
title: All I Have 13/15
body:
Pairing: Biker!Peter Parker x Reader

**Reminder: I write ANDREW GARFIELD as my Peter Parker **

Warnings: Language. Parental abuse. Arranged marriage. Shitty parent. I Guess Boarder line cheating. Lying. Secrets. Sneaking around.

Your daddy has a plan for you. He’s a strict man, with a belt and gun. You know better than to stray from the path, from the rules he set out for you. You’re promised to a good man,but not much of a man. Secretly your hear beats for bad boy, biker Peter Parker. He’s been hounding you for a date, a ride on his motorcycle, for one word; yes. You keep turning him down, because if your daddy finds out about Peter, he’ll kill the both of you. But Peter isn’t backing down that easy. He knows what you want and he’ll get that yes.

Howie: Get to the diner now.

He read the text a hundred times, in the amount of time it took Bucky to drive to the diner in town. The diner looks closed down, when Buck parks sideways in the lot. Fear twists in his gut, as the two of them dart of out the truck and up the steps. Aunt May is fussing over Y/N who’s sitting at the counter, Uncle Ben is handing over a bag of ice to her, trading out the half melted bag she already had on her face. Howie looks like he’s ready to drop dead or smash someone’s teeth in.

“What the hell happened?!” Peter moves across the diner towards Y/N who’s head snaps up. Surprise on her face said Howie hadn’t told her he was on his way.

“Damn it Howard! You called him!” She reaches over, punching Howie in the chest.

“He’s going to see your face anyways!” Howie scuffs, they already sound like bickering siblings.

“What happened to your face?” He moves around Aunt May, turning Y/N’s face. Her hair was a mess, there was dirt and wet spots on her uniform, her cheek was already forming a massive purple and black bruise. “Fucking hell Y/N?” His growing massive.

“Her fucking father showed up.” Howie explains, when he turns his glare on his little brother.

“Where were you!?” Peter let’s go of Y/N. Shoving Howie in the shoulder.

“I was grabbing the other bags! I was not even a minute behind her!” Howie bounces back, just as mad.

“Howie. Peter.” Ben scolds them.

“Not the problem, right now.” Buck steps between them. “What happened?” Buck turns looking at Y/N who sighs, shaking her head.

“It’s not Howie’s fault, Buck.” She picks up the ice placing it on her cheek.

“He was supposed to be watching out for you.” Peter growls. Y/N turns snatching the half melted bag of ice off the counter, she throws it at him. “Hey!” He scuffs being plastered with water droplets, the bag hits him in the chest.

“He was waiting for me.” She glares at him. “I didn’t make it out of the door. He hit me as soon as I opened the back door.” She settles back into her seat.

“Fuck.” He swallows.

“He hit me. He stood over me, I knew to stay down. He told me he knew what a slut I was. That I was going to pay for thinking I could break his rules.” She glances up. “He knows about you. Jesse told him. He knows we’re engaged, he saw the ring.” She swallows. “He promised to kill the both of us. Then he heard Howie calling me name. He was just gone.”

“I’m going to kill him.” He scraps his hand down his face.

“Peter.” Aunt May tisks at him.

“Aunt May.” Peter growls back.

“Just take me home. Please.” Y/N sighs.

“Come on, Darlin’.” He steps forward, pulling her up.




You had the afternoon to dinner shift at the diner, Peter agreed to stay with you for it. You’d required Wanda’s help covering up as much as you could of the bruise on the side of your face. It was noticeable but not at bad when you didn’t have makeup on it.

Peter caught you around the waist, both arms around you. His chin on your shoulder as you laugh, he places a soft kiss on your jaw. The door chimes and footsteps come to a stop near you, making you look up. Your body freezes as you stare back at the man standing before you.

“Little girl.” He smiles softly.

“Granddaddy.” You breathe, your eyes wide. Peter still wrapped around you. He freezes, before slowly slipping off you. “What are you doing here.” You clear your throat.

“To see you.” He nods.

“Me?” Your brow connects. You’d never called him, you couldn’t understand why he was standing in your work place.

“Your daddy called. Saying some biker took you away, was brain washing you, or holding you against your will.” He eyes Peter for a moment.

“Lord no.” You shake your head. “I was going to call you, but something, something sort of happened.” You flush.

“Does that something have to do with the bruise on your face?” He looked stern suddenly.

“Yes, Sir.” You nod, fidgeting with your apron.

“You do this to my granddaughter?” Your granddaddy looks at Peter.

“Never in my life.” Peter shakes his head.

“God no, Peter would never. He’s never hurt me.” You explain quickly.

“Perhaps we should have a conversation?” He looks around.

“Yes. Um sit down.” You usher him towards a clean booth.

“Peter Parker, Sir.” Peter puts his hand out to your granddaddy. Who eyes it for a moment before he shakes it.

“Logan.” Your grandfather nods, the three of you sitting down. You on the inside of the booth your grandfather across from you and Peter.

“My daddy told you I was kidnapped?” You shake your head.

“Told me I need to move your trust over to his power. You weren’t in proper state of mind.” He nods, folding his hands on the table. Your world tips slightly.

“I’m sorry, the fuck did you say?” You blink at him. He smirks slightly but remains composed. His dark hair is greying deeply, and well combed back. His full beard was dark but greying as well. He wore a proper suit, open jacket and plain white button down.

“Which part?” He asks, amusement in his hazel eyes.

“Trust? What fucking trust?” You shake your head, staring at him in disbelief.

“I had a feeling.” He nods, leaning back in his seat. You and Peter exchange the same confused look. “Which is why I came for myself.”

“You’re messing with me right?” You blink.

“Maybe you should tell me what you know.” Your grandfather smirks.

“I’ll have Wanda take over your tables.” Peter gives your hand a squeeze.

“You put that ring on her finger?” Your grandfather looks from your hands on the table to Peter.

“Yes, Sir.” He nods.

“Stick around, Please.” Your grandfather gives a slow nod. You and Peter look at each other before he nods, standing to find Wanda. What the hell was going on in your family?

trail.content_raw:
Pairing: Biker!Peter Parker x Reader

**Reminder: I write ANDREW GARFIELD as my Peter Parker **

Warnings: Language. Parental abuse. Arranged marriage. Shitty parent. I Guess Boarder line cheating. Lying. Secrets. Sneaking around.

Your daddy has a plan for you. He’s a strict man, with a belt and gun. You know better than to stray from the path, from the rules he set out for you. You’re promised to a good man,but not much of a man. Secretly your hear beats for bad boy, biker Peter Parker. He’s been hounding you for a date, a ride on his motorcycle, for one word; yes. You keep turning him down, because if your daddy finds out about Peter, he’ll kill the both of you. But Peter isn’t backing down that easy. He knows what you want and he’ll get that yes.

[[MORE]]

Howie: Get to the diner now.

He read the text a hundred times, in the amount of time it took Bucky to drive to the diner in town. The diner looks closed down, when Buck parks sideways in the lot. Fear twists in his gut, as the two of them dart of out the truck and up the steps. Aunt May is fussing over Y/N who’s sitting at the counter, Uncle Ben is handing over a bag of ice to her, trading out the half melted bag she already had on her face. Howie looks like he’s ready to drop dead or smash someone’s teeth in.

“What the hell happened?!” Peter moves across the diner towards Y/N who’s head snaps up. Surprise on her face said Howie hadn’t told her he was on his way.

“Damn it Howard! You called him!” She reaches over, punching Howie in the chest.

“He’s going to see your face anyways!” Howie scuffs, they already sound like bickering siblings.

“What happened to your face?” He moves around Aunt May, turning Y/N’s face. Her hair was a mess, there was dirt and wet spots on her uniform, her cheek was already forming a massive purple and black bruise. “Fucking hell Y/N?” His growing massive.

“Her fucking father showed up.” Howie explains, when he turns his glare on his little brother.

“Where were you!?” Peter let’s go of Y/N. Shoving Howie in the shoulder.

“I was grabbing the other bags! I was not even a minute behind her!” Howie bounces back, just as mad.

“Howie. Peter.” Ben scolds them.

“Not the problem, right now.” Buck steps between them. “What happened?” Buck turns looking at Y/N who sighs, shaking her head.

“It’s not Howie’s fault, Buck.” She picks up the ice placing it on her cheek.

“He was supposed to be watching out for you.” Peter growls. Y/N turns snatching the half melted bag of ice off the counter, she throws it at him. “Hey!” He scuffs being plastered with water droplets, the bag hits him in the chest.

“He was waiting for me.” She glares at him. “I didn’t make it out of the door. He hit me as soon as I opened the back door.” She settles back into her seat.

“Fuck.” He swallows.

“He hit me. He stood over me, I knew to stay down. He told me he knew what a slut I was. That I was going to pay for thinking I could break his rules.” She glances up. “He knows about you. Jesse told him. He knows we’re engaged, he saw the ring.” She swallows. “He promised to kill the both of us. Then he heard Howie calling me name. He was just gone.”

“I’m going to kill him.” He scraps his hand down his face.

“Peter.” Aunt May tisks at him.

“Aunt May.” Peter growls back.

“Just take me home. Please.” Y/N sighs.

“Come on, Darlin’.” He steps forward, pulling her up.




You had the afternoon to dinner shift at the diner, Peter agreed to stay with you for it. You’d required Wanda’s help covering up as much as you could of the bruise on the side of your face. It was noticeable but not at bad when you didn’t have makeup on it.

Peter caught you around the waist, both arms around you. His chin on your shoulder as you laugh, he places a soft kiss on your jaw. The door chimes and footsteps come to a stop near you, making you look up. Your body freezes as you stare back at the man standing before you.

“Little girl.” He smiles softly.

“Granddaddy.” You breathe, your eyes wide. Peter still wrapped around you. He freezes, before slowly slipping off you. “What are you doing here.” You clear your throat.

“To see you.” He nods.

“Me?” Your brow connects. You’d never called him, you couldn’t understand why he was standing in your work place.

“Your daddy called. Saying some biker took you away, was brain washing you, or holding you against your will.” He eyes Peter for a moment.

“Lord no.” You shake your head. “I was going to call you, but something, something sort of happened.” You flush.

“Does that something have to do with the bruise on your face?” He looked stern suddenly.

“Yes, Sir.” You nod, fidgeting with your apron.

“You do this to my granddaughter?” Your granddaddy looks at Peter.

“Never in my life.” Peter shakes his head.

“God no, Peter would never. He’s never hurt me.” You explain quickly.

“Perhaps we should have a conversation?” He looks around.

“Yes. Um sit down.” You usher him towards a clean booth.

“Peter Parker, Sir.” Peter puts his hand out to your granddaddy. Who eyes it for a moment before he shakes it.

“Logan.” Your grandfather nods, the three of you sitting down. You on the inside of the booth your grandfather across from you and Peter.

“My daddy told you I was kidnapped?” You shake your head.

“Told me I need to move your trust over to his power. You weren’t in proper state of mind.” He nods, folding his hands on the table. Your world tips slightly.

“I’m sorry, the fuck did you say?” You blink at him. He smirks slightly but remains composed. His dark hair is greying deeply, and well combed back. His full beard was dark but greying as well. He wore a proper suit, open jacket and plain white button down.

“Which part?” He asks, amusement in his hazel eyes.

“Trust? What fucking trust?” You shake your head, staring at him in disbelief.

“I had a feeling.” He nods, leaning back in his seat. You and Peter exchange the same confused look. “Which is why I came for myself.”

“You’re messing with me right?” You blink.

“Maybe you should tell me what you know.” Your grandfather smirks.

“I’ll have Wanda take over your tables.” Peter gives your hand a squeeze.

“You put that ring on her finger?” Your grandfather looks from your hands on the table to Peter.

“Yes, Sir.” He nods.

“Stick around, Please.” Your grandfather gives a slow nod. You and Peter look at each other before he nods, standing to find Wanda. What the hell was going on in your family?

summary: Wait, Natasha didn't call herself a monster because she is sterilised? She calls herself a monster because she killed people...
question: Wait, Natasha didn't call herself a monster because she is sterilised? She calls herself a monster because she killed people without remorse. Being sterilised kept her from going down the good path, because it was the one thing for Natasha to stop killing. The fact that she was sterilised kept her a monster.
answer:
• Bruce Banner: You sure? Even if I didn’t just…there’s no future with me. I can’t ever…I can’t have this, kids, do the math, I physically can’t.
  • Natasha Romanoff: Neither can I. In the Red Room, where I was trained, where I was raised, um, they have a graduation ceremony. They sterilize you. It’s efficient. One less thing to worry about. The one thing that might matter more than a mission. It makes everything easier. Even killing. [she hesitates a moment] You still think you’re the only monster on the team?

That, my friend, my buddy, my pal, is not about being a killer. No where in that text does she make killing the subject - it’s being sterile that’s the subject of her reply. If it was about killing, she never would’ve mentioned being sterilised in the same breath as being a monster. Also, a baby would’ve never been the “one thing” to stop Natasha from killing - she could’ve made her mind up at any time about that. She could’ve stopped at any time. No, being an assassin is her identity and she’s fine with that.

Bruce called himself a monster because of the Hulk, because he’s a danger and it means he can’t have this, kids, do the math, I physically can’t.

Natasha immediately told him she’s sterilised. Finishing her mini-monologue with calling herself a monster. She has never once shown to regret being a killer, never once shown in any way, shape or form that she is uncomfortable with it. Even in the Red Room, the only thing that made her hesitate was the fact that she didn’t want to be sterilised. Natasha Romanoff is fine with being an assassin. She does, however, seem to think that her being sterilised is the same as being a large green rage monster.

Being sterilised doesn’t make you a monster and it doesn’t keep you one, if you were before. Yet the text says that that’s how it makes her feel, and that’s just a plain bad message, that Joss “I’m a feminist” Whedon should’ve spent an extra five seconds thinking about before giving the okay to.

  • Natasha Romanoff: Neither can I. In the Red Room, where I was trained, where I was raised, um, they have a graduation ceremony. They sterilize you. It’s efficient. One less thing to worry about. The one thing that might matter more than a mission. It makes everything easier. Even killing. [she hesitates a moment] You still think you’re the only monster on the team?

That, my friend, my buddy, my pal, is not about being a killer. No where in that text does she make killing the subject - it’s being sterile that’s the subject of her reply. If it was about killing, she never would’ve mentioned being sterilised in the same breath as being a monster. Also, a baby would’ve never been the “one thing” to stop Natasha from killing - she could’ve made her mind up at any time about that. She could’ve stopped at any time. No, being an assassin is her identity and she’s fine with that.

Bruce called himself a monster because of the Hulk, because he’s a danger and it means he can’t have this, kids, do the math, I physically can’t.

Natasha immediately told him she’s sterilised. Finishing her mini-monologue with calling herself a monster. She has never once shown to regret being a killer, never once shown in any way, shape or form that she is uncomfortable with it. Even in the Red Room, the only thing that made her hesitate was the fact that she didn’t want to be sterilised. Natasha Romanoff is fine with being an assassin. She does, however, seem to think that her being sterilised is the same as being a large green rage monster.

Being sterilised doesn’t make you a monster and it doesn’t keep you one, if you were before. Yet the text says that that’s how it makes her feel, and that’s just a plain bad message, that Joss “I’m a feminist” Whedon should’ve spent an extra five seconds thinking about before giving the okay to.

summary: Cool Kids 28
title: Cool Kids 28
body:
Pairing: Steve Rogers x Reader!Castle

Warning: Violence. Wish of dying. Mentions of assault. Fighting. Violent past. Stabbing. Hostile anger. Dislike for being touched. Mentions of death. Breaking laws. Revenge/Payback. Defiance in school.

Characters: Steve Rogers. Bucky Barnes. Sam Wilson. Becca Barnes. Frank Castle. Luke Cage. Matt Murdock. Mary MacPherran. Amora Lorelei. Wanda Maximoff. Kaine Parker. Peter Parker. Ben Reilly.
[if you have questions about who some of these Characters are, feel free to ask]

(Half way through I removed the synopsis as it’s longer and annoying to copy over after this long)

Tag List Is Open!!

Make Sure You Read The Warnings. Things get ugly from here on out. If you’re not ready for, Mentions of assault. Violence. Or vulgar sexual suggestion.
Stop reading here please and thank you.
Understand this is going to carry on through the rest of the series.

Since the Crew put out a claim on Brock, he’d gone underground. Hiding. Your brother texted you saying he wouldn’t be home till late. Your stomach turned.

You: Crew Business?
Frank: Devil No See Without Eyes.

Your stomach lurched, you pulled the Jeep over, shoving your door open. You scooped your loose hair up and tossed your stomach contents into the side of the road.

“Y/N?” Nat leans over rubbing a hand over your back. “Let me drive.” Her voice soft. You slowly nod, the three of you swap spots, Nat sits in the driver’s seat, pulling the door closed, Bec’s was in the backseat now, and you dropped into the passenger seat. Your head drops back, your eyes sinking closed. “What does that mean?” She asks softly as she pulls back on to the road.

“Means, nobody will speak of what’s being done. Brock slipped up, he’s in my brothers hands.” You reply softly.

“Right.” She nods slowly, eyes on the road, but you saw her swallow hard.

“Should we call the guys?” Bec’s asks softly from the backseat.

“Not now. When we’re home.” You whisper in the quiet Jeep. You were heading for your place; a sleepover was in the plans. Now you were sure nobody wanted to part, Crew War had started, nothing was going to be the same again.

“Shit.” You sigh, hanging your head as Nat pulled into the drive. The house was dark, the porch light hadn’t been turned on.

“Here.” Bec’s holds up her phone, the flashlight turned on.

“You fall I’m laughing at you.” Nat smirks.

“Fuck you.” You snort. “I’ll push your ass.” You bump your hip as the three of you start up the barely lit path to the house.

“We could knock her down, steal her phone and watch her blind mice it up the walk?” Nat laughs.

“Fuck you bitches.” Bec’s laughs. The three of you giggle, bumping into each other.

A brief moment, the calm before the fucking hurricane coming.

The demons were coming for their pound of flesh.

It’s always darkest before the dawn.

It happened in slow motion, later when you replayed it for yourself, there was never a chance for you to stop it. Bec’s phone clattered to the path, as she let out a yelp, suddenly gone from next to you. You and Nat spin to look, something, someone collides with her. In the darkness you can see them rolling together across the grass.

Your hand reaches back, ready to pull your knife, the blow came from the dark, straight to the jaw. Your body hit the path with a thump, you could taste blood and fear mixed into it. The blows came, with no way to fight back. You can’t fight what you can’t see.

You didn’t beg, you didn’t cry, but when the voice came from the dark you shivered violently. Dread smoked a trail down your spine and filled your stomach.

“Do you have the upper hand now?” The voice chuckles, its dark and threatening.

Another blow, forces you to roll on to your back. Bec’s whimpers in the dark, as if someone was covering her mouth. Someone curses and she’s screaming your name. Your hand slips under you, freeing your knife, you groan, rolling to your side. You slowly push yourself up, someone steps forward, your hand drives through the dark, planting your knife into skin. Skin you were sure was a thigh. If your aim was right, it was close enough to the artery.

“Fuck she stabbed me!” Someone yells, crying in pain before your knife clatters to the ground.

“Run boys. You’ll need a hospital to keep your boy from bleeding out.” You laugh, coughing. You spit blood as you shove yourself up on all fours. “Don’t worry, I’m coming for you.” You giggle, it’s creepy and menacing in the dark. You hear several sets of footsteps hurrying away, someone crying out as doors open to vehicles stashed in the dark.

“Bec’s!” You yell, coughing, you shove yourself up stumbling in the dark.

“Y/N!” She cries, she was sobbing. Hands touch you, she shrieks as you crash into the ground.

“Y/N!” Nat yells, you could feel her getting closer.

“Here.” You cough.

“Fuck!” She drops to her knees next to you. Her hands brush over your face.

“We gotta, we should get inside.” You groan, rolling on to your side again. “Bec’s get the keys.” Nat sounds frantic, Bec’s sniffles fumbling with your jacket pockets. Nat pulls you up.

“Oh fuck!” You groan at the burst of pain in your side.

“Shit. Shit. I’m sorry.” Nat was typically calm and collected. You couldn’t see her, but you could feel the panic rolling off her, the fear she was feeling.

“Okay. Okay.” Bec’s clatters the keys together in front of the door as Nat helps you up the steps. “Here we go.” She shoves the door open, before coming to your other side and helping you into the house as well. Bec’s slaps the light as Nat kicks the door shut, with a loud bang.

“Oh fuck.” Nat blinks massive eyes at you.

“Couch.” You nod towards the living room. They help you sit down, before coming to stand in front of you, looking you over. “How bad?” You ask.

“We have to take you to the hospital.” Bec’s shakes her head.

“Phone.” You groan. Nat hurries handing over your phone that had been in your back pocket before the fight. You swipe the lock, pressing T, you put the phone to your ear.

“Luci?” He answers on the second ring.

“A Bird Can’t Sing Without A Beak.” You groan, licking your lips.

“Coming.” T growls, before he hangs up.

“What?” Nat blinks at you.

“Means don’t speak a word, come now.” Bec’s explains. You look her over, her hair was a mess, she was dirty, there were grass stains on her jeans and there was a building bruise on her cheek. Your eyes cut to Nat, she’s dirty, her lips split, and fear still hides in her eyes.

“Did they say anything to either of you?” You ask attempting to lean forward.

“Um.” Bec’s swallows. “Something about following you will get me killed.” She shrugs, shaking. Your brow lifts and you wince.

“He told me I was going to learn which Crew was on top.” Nat nods, running a hand through her messy red hair, before she drops on to the couch.

Bec’s jumps at the sound of squealing tires and a roar of an engine. Only a breathe later it was quiet before the front door bangs open. Bec’s yelps, Nat flinches and you wince trying to stand quickly.

“What the fuck happened!?” T yells, rushing towards you.

“T.” You wince.

“We got jumped.” Bec’s shivers.

“By who!?” T moves to her, looking over her face.

“Kaine. He spoke to me in the dark.” You take a ragged breathe.

“Call your fucking brothers Rebecca.” T orders, Bec’s jumps taking your phone.

“My phones still outside.” She sniffs, as she dials.

“It’s fine.” You nod. T drops to a knee in front of you and Nat.

“What did he say?” He looks you over, his thumb comes up, wiping a stray trail of blood from your lip.

“Do you have the upper had now?” You swallow.

“Buck. Steve?” Bec’s cringes. “Something happened. You should get to Y/N’s now.” She flinches at whatever is said on the other end, she nods, before hanging up.

“I’m calling the guys.” T stands up, brushing a hand over Nat’s cheek.

“T, did they. You guys, Brock?” You pant looking up at him.

“Don’t worry your pretty little mind about that Luci. Don’t worry with a thought of him again.” He nods, pulling his phone out, he steps back.

“Right.” You nod slowly, sinking back into the couch.

Brock was dead, there was nothing more to say. You were the reason your brothers took a man’s life. She settled in on your shoulder, wrapping you in a warm comfort protection from your feelings. You didn’t flinch when the door throws open once more, Buck, Sam and Steve yelling, storming in. You didn’t look up as hands closed around your face, when your chin is nudged up, your face to face with seething blue eyes.

“What the fuck happened?!” Buck yells. Bec’s bursts into tears, her hands cover her eyes and her shoulders shake. “Fuck.” Buck groans, he pulls his sister in, wrapping her in a tight hug.

“Look at me. Come on.” Steve urges you. Your eyes flick to him once more.

“What happened?” He pleads with you.

“The demons came for their pound of flesh.” You reply, your tone, detached, cold, empty.

“We need to get you to a hospital.” T is standing over Steve. Watching you intently.

“Do you taste blood?” Steve asks, looking confused. You move your tongue, you did indeed taste blood still.

“Yeah.” You nod.

“Y/N we should get that checked out.” Nat brushes your hair back. “Can you stand up?” She asks. You shove yourself up, Steve waits as you sway slightly.

“I’m, I’m,” your tongue felt fuzzy and the room spun before suddenly it was black. Your body dropped, Steve’s arms catch you, T curses and starts dialing. Buck’s shouting orders, everyone scrambles. Steve scoops you up and rushes out the door with T shouting into his phone.

The hurricane had arrived, nothing was calm anymore.

trail.content_raw:
Pairing: Steve Rogers x Reader!Castle

Warning: Violence. Wish of dying. Mentions of assault. Fighting. Violent past. Stabbing. Hostile anger. Dislike for being touched. Mentions of death. Breaking laws. Revenge/Payback. Defiance in school.

Characters: Steve Rogers. Bucky Barnes. Sam Wilson. Becca Barnes. Frank Castle. Luke Cage. Matt Murdock. Mary MacPherran. Amora Lorelei. Wanda Maximoff. Kaine Parker. Peter Parker. Ben Reilly.
[if you have questions about who some of these Characters are, feel free to ask]

(Half way through I removed the synopsis as it’s longer and annoying to copy over after this long)

Tag List Is Open!!

Make Sure You Read The Warnings. Things get ugly from here on out. If you’re not ready for, Mentions of assault. Violence. Or vulgar sexual suggestion.
Stop reading here please and thank you.
Understand this is going to carry on through the rest of the series.

[[MORE]]

Since the Crew put out a claim on Brock, he’d gone underground. Hiding. Your brother texted you saying he wouldn’t be home till late. Your stomach turned.

You: Crew Business?
Frank: Devil No See Without Eyes.

Your stomach lurched, you pulled the Jeep over, shoving your door open. You scooped your loose hair up and tossed your stomach contents into the side of the road.

“Y/N?” Nat leans over rubbing a hand over your back. “Let me drive.” Her voice soft. You slowly nod, the three of you swap spots, Nat sits in the driver’s seat, pulling the door closed, Bec’s was in the backseat now, and you dropped into the passenger seat. Your head drops back, your eyes sinking closed. “What does that mean?” She asks softly as she pulls back on to the road.

“Means, nobody will speak of what’s being done. Brock slipped up, he’s in my brothers hands.” You reply softly.

“Right.” She nods slowly, eyes on the road, but you saw her swallow hard.

“Should we call the guys?” Bec’s asks softly from the backseat.

“Not now. When we’re home.” You whisper in the quiet Jeep. You were heading for your place; a sleepover was in the plans. Now you were sure nobody wanted to part, Crew War had started, nothing was going to be the same again.

“Shit.” You sigh, hanging your head as Nat pulled into the drive. The house was dark, the porch light hadn’t been turned on.

“Here.” Bec’s holds up her phone, the flashlight turned on.

“You fall I’m laughing at you.” Nat smirks.

“Fuck you.” You snort. “I’ll push your ass.” You bump your hip as the three of you start up the barely lit path to the house.

“We could knock her down, steal her phone and watch her blind mice it up the walk?” Nat laughs.

“Fuck you bitches.” Bec’s laughs. The three of you giggle, bumping into each other.

A brief moment, the calm before the fucking hurricane coming.

The demons were coming for their pound of flesh.

It’s always darkest before the dawn.

It happened in slow motion, later when you replayed it for yourself, there was never a chance for you to stop it. Bec’s phone clattered to the path, as she let out a yelp, suddenly gone from next to you. You and Nat spin to look, something, someone collides with her. In the darkness you can see them rolling together across the grass.

Your hand reaches back, ready to pull your knife, the blow came from the dark, straight to the jaw. Your body hit the path with a thump, you could taste blood and fear mixed into it. The blows came, with no way to fight back. You can’t fight what you can’t see.

You didn’t beg, you didn’t cry, but when the voice came from the dark you shivered violently. Dread smoked a trail down your spine and filled your stomach.

“Do you have the upper hand now?” The voice chuckles, its dark and threatening.

Another blow, forces you to roll on to your back. Bec’s whimpers in the dark, as if someone was covering her mouth. Someone curses and she’s screaming your name. Your hand slips under you, freeing your knife, you groan, rolling to your side. You slowly push yourself up, someone steps forward, your hand drives through the dark, planting your knife into skin. Skin you were sure was a thigh. If your aim was right, it was close enough to the artery.

“Fuck she stabbed me!” Someone yells, crying in pain before your knife clatters to the ground.

“Run boys. You’ll need a hospital to keep your boy from bleeding out.” You laugh, coughing. You spit blood as you shove yourself up on all fours. “Don’t worry, I’m coming for you.” You giggle, it’s creepy and menacing in the dark. You hear several sets of footsteps hurrying away, someone crying out as doors open to vehicles stashed in the dark.

“Bec’s!” You yell, coughing, you shove yourself up stumbling in the dark.

“Y/N!” She cries, she was sobbing. Hands touch you, she shrieks as you crash into the ground.

“Y/N!” Nat yells, you could feel her getting closer.

“Here.” You cough.

“Fuck!” She drops to her knees next to you. Her hands brush over your face.

“We gotta, we should get inside.” You groan, rolling on to your side again. “Bec’s get the keys.” Nat sounds frantic, Bec’s sniffles fumbling with your jacket pockets. Nat pulls you up.

“Oh fuck!” You groan at the burst of pain in your side.

“Shit. Shit. I’m sorry.” Nat was typically calm and collected. You couldn’t see her, but you could feel the panic rolling off her, the fear she was feeling.

“Okay. Okay.” Bec’s clatters the keys together in front of the door as Nat helps you up the steps. “Here we go.” She shoves the door open, before coming to your other side and helping you into the house as well. Bec’s slaps the light as Nat kicks the door shut, with a loud bang.

“Oh fuck.” Nat blinks massive eyes at you.

“Couch.” You nod towards the living room. They help you sit down, before coming to stand in front of you, looking you over. “How bad?” You ask.

“We have to take you to the hospital.” Bec’s shakes her head.

“Phone.” You groan. Nat hurries handing over your phone that had been in your back pocket before the fight. You swipe the lock, pressing T, you put the phone to your ear.

“Luci?” He answers on the second ring.

“A Bird Can’t Sing Without A Beak.” You groan, licking your lips.

“Coming.” T growls, before he hangs up.

“What?” Nat blinks at you.

“Means don’t speak a word, come now.” Bec’s explains. You look her over, her hair was a mess, she was dirty, there were grass stains on her jeans and there was a building bruise on her cheek. Your eyes cut to Nat, she’s dirty, her lips split, and fear still hides in her eyes.

“Did they say anything to either of you?” You ask attempting to lean forward.

“Um.” Bec’s swallows. “Something about following you will get me killed.” She shrugs, shaking. Your brow lifts and you wince.

“He told me I was going to learn which Crew was on top.” Nat nods, running a hand through her messy red hair, before she drops on to the couch.

Bec’s jumps at the sound of squealing tires and a roar of an engine. Only a breathe later it was quiet before the front door bangs open. Bec’s yelps, Nat flinches and you wince trying to stand quickly.

“What the fuck happened!?” T yells, rushing towards you.

“T.” You wince.

“We got jumped.” Bec’s shivers.

“By who!?” T moves to her, looking over her face.

“Kaine. He spoke to me in the dark.” You take a ragged breathe.

“Call your fucking brothers Rebecca.” T orders, Bec’s jumps taking your phone.

“My phones still outside.” She sniffs, as she dials.

“It’s fine.” You nod. T drops to a knee in front of you and Nat.

“What did he say?” He looks you over, his thumb comes up, wiping a stray trail of blood from your lip.

“Do you have the upper had now?” You swallow.

“Buck. Steve?” Bec’s cringes. “Something happened. You should get to Y/N’s now.” She flinches at whatever is said on the other end, she nods, before hanging up.

“I’m calling the guys.” T stands up, brushing a hand over Nat’s cheek.

“T, did they. You guys, Brock?” You pant looking up at him.

“Don’t worry your pretty little mind about that Luci. Don’t worry with a thought of him again.” He nods, pulling his phone out, he steps back.

“Right.” You nod slowly, sinking back into the couch.

Brock was dead, there was nothing more to say. You were the reason your brothers took a man’s life. She settled in on your shoulder, wrapping you in a warm comfort protection from your feelings. You didn’t flinch when the door throws open once more, Buck, Sam and Steve yelling, storming in. You didn’t look up as hands closed around your face, when your chin is nudged up, your face to face with seething blue eyes.

“What the fuck happened?!” Buck yells. Bec’s bursts into tears, her hands cover her eyes and her shoulders shake. “Fuck.” Buck groans, he pulls his sister in, wrapping her in a tight hug.

“Look at me. Come on.” Steve urges you. Your eyes flick to him once more.

“What happened?” He pleads with you.

“The demons came for their pound of flesh.” You reply, your tone, detached, cold, empty.

“We need to get you to a hospital.” T is standing over Steve. Watching you intently.

“Do you taste blood?” Steve asks, looking confused. You move your tongue, you did indeed taste blood still.

“Yeah.” You nod.

“Y/N we should get that checked out.” Nat brushes your hair back. “Can you stand up?” She asks. You shove yourself up, Steve waits as you sway slightly.

“I’m, I’m,” your tongue felt fuzzy and the room spun before suddenly it was black. Your body dropped, Steve’s arms catch you, T curses and starts dialing. Buck’s shouting orders, everyone scrambles. Steve scoops you up and rushes out the door with T shouting into his phone.

The hurricane had arrived, nothing was calm anymore.
